Package gchess.chess

Class ChessGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • gchess.boardgame.BoardGame<ChessBoard>
      • gchess.chess.ChessGame
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Atomic, Chess960, KingOfTheHill, ThreeCheck

    public class ChessGame
extends BoardGame<ChessBoard>

    Chess Game

    This class is the classic chess game and is the core of any implementation of any chess mode. Examples for modes you can create on top of it: Chess960, Atomic, King-Of-The-Hill and so much more.
    Since:
    2018-04-23

      • undoMove

        public void undoMove​()
        This function return to the state of the game before the last move. Undo twice to go back two states before and so on.
        Specified by:
        undoMove in class BoardGame<ChessBoard>

      • getCopy

        public BoardGame<ChessBoard> getCopy​()
        This function returns a copy of the current game so that any modifications on the copy won't affect the current game.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        A copy of the game.

      • getBoardRepresentation

        public Piece[][] getBoardRepresentation​()
        This function returns a nice and easy representation of the chess board using N x M matrix and enums of pieces.
        Returns:
        N x M matrix of pieces enums.

      • isKingHasToBeSafe

        protected boolean isKingHasToBeSafe​()
        This function determines whether the king needs to be safe or not. Safe means that no enemy piece can attack the king in the current state. Note: This function is there to be overrated by game-modes that don't need the king to be safe.
        Returns:
        true if the king needs to be safe, false otherwise.

      • initBoard

        protected void initBoard​()
        This function initiate the board with pieces for when the game starts.

      • isUnderCheck

        protected boolean isUnderCheck​()
        This function checks if the king of current alliance is under check.
        Returns:

      • getSpecialEndGameState

        protected GameEnded getSpecialEndGameState​()
        This function returns the current special end game state, if there isn't any it returns null. Note: This function is meant to be overrated by other game-modes that have special end-game states.
        Returns:
        Current special end-game state

      • getCurrentTurnAlliance

        protected Alliance getCurrentTurnAlliance​()
        This function returns the current turn alliance.
        Returns:
        Alliance of current turn.

      • onMakeMoveFinished

        protected void onMakeMoveFinished​(Move move)
        This function is called after a move has finished executing. Note: This function is meant to be overrated by other game-modes that needs this kind of additional functionality.
        Parameters:
        move - The move that has finished executing before this call.

      • onUndoMoveStarted

        protected void onUndoMoveStarted​(Move move)
        This function is called before an undo operation is executed. Note: This function is meant to be overrated by other game-modes that needs this kind of additional functionality.
        Parameters:
        move - The move that is going to be canceled after this call.
